title: Quiz - SchemesTap - 23rd to 31st July 2023
instruction: Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) was launched in the year 2016 by NITI Aayog with an objective to create and promote an ecosystem of innovation and entrepreneurship across the country at school, university, research institutions, MSME and industry levels. It is envisaged as an umbrella innovation organization that would play an instrumental role in alignment of innovation policies between central, state and sectoral innovation schemes.

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are incorrect with respect to the above scheme? 1.  There is a provision for National Executive Committee (NEC) under the scheme which is headed by PM, it provides policy direction to programme framework. 2. National Steering Committee (NSC) headed by Vice Chairman of NITI Aayog, oversees programme implementation at national level and address adminstrational issues. 3. Promotional activities relating to water harvesting, water management and crop alignment are also covered under the objective of the scheme.
options: 1 and 2
1 and 3
Only 2
Only 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following schemes is/are component of  the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph? 1. Accelerated Irrigation Benefit Programme (AIBP) 2. Per Drop More Crop 3. On Farm Water Management (OFWM)
options: 1 and 2
1 and 3
2 and 3
1, 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Which statement among the following is incorrect with respect to above scheme?
options: The scheme is implemented in an area development approach
It adopts decentralized state level planning and projectised execution
Watershed Development Component (WDC) of the scheme is implemented by Ministry of Jal Shakti
It is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme
Scheme also explores the feasibility of reusing treated municipal wastewater

quiz.text: Under the above scheme, the difference between premium and insurance charges payable by farmers shall be shared by the Central and State Government {in all States/UTs except North Eastern Region (NER)} in the ratio of ___. (RBI GRADE-B PHASE -1, 2023)
options: 60:40
70:30
50:50
None of the Above

quiz.text:
Which statement(s) among the following is/are correct with respect to above scheme?
1. Scheme encourages farmers to adopt innovative and modern agricultural practices.
2. Tenant farmers growing notified crops in a notified area are not eligible for benefits.
3. Scheme is compulsory for loanee farmers.
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 1 and 2
(C) Only 2
(D) Only 2 and 3
(E) All of the above

quiz.text: Which statement(s) among the following is/are incorrect with respect to above scheme?1. There is provision for crop loss due to attack by wild animals.2. In cases of Post-Harvest Losses coverage is available only upto a maximum period of 4 weeks from harvesting.3.Losses arising out of war and nuclear risks, malicious damage other preventable risks are also covered under the scheme.
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 2
(C) Only 2 and 3
(D) Only 3
(E) None of the above

quiz.text:
Which statement(s) among the following is/are correct in reference to Rashtriya Arogya Nidhi (RAN)?
1. It consist of 2 components.
2. Rashtriya Arogya Nidhi (RAN) component provides financial assistance for treatment of life-threatening diseases relating to heart, kidney, liver, etc. at Government and private hospitals/institutes having Super Specialty facilities.
3. Maximum financial assistance is ₹15 lakhs under Rashtriya Arogya Nidhi (RAN) component.
options: (A) Only 2
(B) Only 2 and 3
(C) Only 1
(D) Only 3
(E) All of the above

quiz.text:
Considering Rashtriya Arogya Nidhi (RAN), identify the statement(s) which is/are incorrect?
1.Families covered under Ayusman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojna (PMJAY) will not be eligible for financial assistance under certain components of this scheme.
2. Those having treatnent in private hospitals will also be eligible for financial assistance under the scheme.
3. Government servants and their families are eligible under the scheme.
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 2
(C) Only 2 and 3
(D) Only 1 and 3
(E) Only 3

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the above scheme? 1. It supports and sustain Children in difficult circumstances. 2. It encourage private sector partnerships and interventions to support children within law. 3. Child Protection Services Scheme  was subsumed under Mission Vatsalya from 2020-21 onwards.
options: 1 and 2
1 and 3
2 and 3
1, 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to above mission? 1. State Child Welfare and Protection Committee to supervise implementation of Mission Vatsalya with the help of State Child Protection Society (SCPS) 2. For non-institutional care financial support at the rate of ₹3000/- per month per child shall be provided to Children (in account with guardian). 3. For child in institutional care, a maintenance grant @ ₹4000/- per month shall be given to Child Care Institutions.
options: Only 1 and 3
Only 1
Only 2 and 3
1, 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: What is the total outlay for Mission Vatsalya?
options: Rs 3988 Crore
Rs 6928 Crore
Rs 8825 Crore
Rs 10916 Crore
Rs 12716 Crore

quiz.text: Which statement(s) among the following is/are incorrect with respect to above scheme?1. Under above scheme after updates focus shifted from 'Every Unbanked Adult' to ‘Every Household’2. Overdraft facility available after satisfactory operation of the account for 12 months.3. Scheme provides overdraft (OD) facility up to Rs. 5000 to every household.4. In case of overdraft no conditions are attached up to Rs 2,000.
options: (A) Only 2 and 3
(B) Only 3
(C) Only 1, 2 and 3
(D) Only 2
(E) Only 1 and 3

quiz.text:
The Scheme was launched initially based upon some pillars, which among the followings are those?
1. Universal access to banking services – Branch and Banking Correspondent (BC)
2. Basic Demat Bank account
3. Creation of Credit Guarantee Fund 
4. Pension scheme for organized sector
options: (A) Only 1 and 3
(B) Only 1 and 2
(C) Only 1 and 4
(D) Only 1, 3 and 4
(E) All of the above

quiz.text:
Which statement(s) among the following is/are correct with respect to above scheme?
1. An app is launched under the scheme to provide a bank centric platform for locating banking touch points.
2.  Accident Insurance Cover under the scheme is Rs 1 Lakh.
3. Account under the scheme is treated as inoperative if there are no customer induced transactions in the account for over a period of 2-years.
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 1 and 3
(C) Only 2 and 3
(D) Only 3
(E) All of the above

quiz.text:
Delhi Lieutenant Governor distributed Honey Bee-Boxes and Toolkits to beneficiaries under 'Gramodyog Vikas Yojna',  which  statement among the following is/are incorrect with respect to Gramodyog Vikas Yojana (GVY)?
1.Ministry of Rural Development is nodal ministry of the scheme.
2. Objective of the scheme is promotion and development of village industries through common facilities, technological modernization, training etc and other support and services
3. Tenure of the scheme is till 2024-25.
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 1 and 2
(C) Only 3
(D) Only 1 and 3
(E) None of the above

quiz.text: Each verticals of the  Gramodyog Vikas Yojana (GVY) are unique and have got unique opportunities and challenges, which statement among the following is incorrect about its component?
options: (A) Agarbatti Industries comes  under Wellness and Cosmetics Industries (WCI)vertical.
(B) Footwear Repairing/ Manufacturing Programme comes under Hand Made Paper, Leather & Plastic Industries (HMPLPI)vertical.
(C) Pottery Activities comes under Rural Engineering & New Technology Industry (RENTI).
(D) Honey Mission Programme/Bee Keeping Activity comes under Agro-Based and Food Processing Industries (ABFPI)vertical.
(E) None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to above programme?

1. Ministry of Commerce and Industry is the Nodal Ministry of the programme.

2. One of the objective of is to generate employment opportunities in only rural areas of country through setting up of new self-employment ventures/projects/micro enterprises.

3. It also focuses on arresting migration of rural youth.

4. At national level Khadi and Village Industries Commission (KVIC) acts as Nodal agency.
options: Only 2 and 3
Only 1, 2 and 4
Only 2 and 4
Only 3 and 4
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the statement(s) is/are incorrect with respect to eligibility for new enterprises (Units) under above programme?1.Individuals above 21 years of Age are eligible.2. There is no income ceiling for assistance.3. Only one person from one family is eligible.4. Existing Units that have already availed Government Subsidy under any other scheme of Government of India or State Government are also eligible.
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 1 and 4
(C) Only 2 and 3
(D) Only 1, 2 and 4
(E) None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to above programme?
1. Funds are available under 3 major heads.
2. Margin Money Subsidy is provided for upgradation of micro enterprises/units.
3. Maximum project cost admissible for Margin Money subsidy in manufacturing Sector is ₹20 lakh.
4. 5% is Beneficiary's contribution (of project cost) in Special Category projects for Margin Money (MM) subsidy.
options: (A) Only 1 and 3
(B) Only 1 and 4
(C) Only 4
(D) Only 2 and 4
(E) All of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are incorrect with respect to the above scheme? 1. It is being implemented by Ministry of Finance. 2. Recently (July 2023) Government gave 2nd extension to the scheme. 3. New tenure of the scheme is till March 31, 2024.
 4. Beneficiaries under the scheme include insured persons covered under Employees’ State Insurance Act, 1948.
options: Only 1
Only 1, 2 and 3
Only 2
Only 2, 3 and 4
None  of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to the relief provided under the above mentioned scheme? 1. The scheme provides relief to the extent of 50% of the average per day earning. 2. Benefit will be settled within 7 days from date of an application. 3. Claim shall become due 30 days after date of unemployment.
options: 1 and 2
1 and 3
2 and 3
1, 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is not among the situations where the relief under the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph is terminated?
options: Less than 1 year contributory service
Dismissal/termination under disciplinary action
Strike resorted to by the employees declared illegal by the competent authority
On being re-employed elsewhere during the period he/she is in receipt of Relief under scheme
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is not one of the components of the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph?
options: Prime Ministers Employment Generation Programme
National Rural Livelihoods Project (NRLP)
Mahila Kisan Sashaktikaran Pariyojana (MKSP)
Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana
All of the above are the scheme components

quiz.text: Which statement(s) among the following is/are incorrect with respect to above scheme?1. In its attempt to financial inclusion on supply side, it promotes financial literacy among poor and provides catalytic capital to SHGs and their federations.2. In financial inclusion on demand side, mission coordinates with financial sector and encourages use of Information, Communication & Technology (ICT) based financial technologies, business correspondents and community facilitators like ‘Bank Mitras’3. It also works on remittances, especially in areas where migration is endemic.
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 2
(C) Only 1 and 2
(D) Only 2 and 3
(E) None of the above

quiz.text: Which statement among the following is/are correct with respect to above scheme?1. Scheme focuses on stabilizing and promoting existing livelihood portfolio of poor through 2 pillars.2.  It encourages private sector banks to set up Rural Self Employment Training Institutes (RSETIs) in all districts of country on lines of Rural Development Self Employment Institute (RUDSETI) model.3. It has unique proposition which involves working with the community institutions through community professionals in the spirit of self-help.
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 1 and 2
(C) Only 1 and 3
(D) Only 3
(E) All of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with reference to Credit Guarantee Scheme for Livestock Sector?
1. Scheme to strengthen credit delivery system and facilitate smooth flow of credit to the Micro, Small & Medium Enterprise (MSMEs) engaged in Livestock sector without hassles of collateral security
2. Scheme to act as a key enabler and risk mitigation measure for lending institutions and enabling collateral free funding to Livestock Sector.
3. It will be implemented under FIDF to strengthen credit delivery system and facilitate smooth flow of credit
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 1 and 2
(C) Only 2 and 3
(D) Only 1 and 3
(E) All of the above

quiz.text: Which statement(s) among the following is/are incorrect with respect to Credit Guarantee Scheme for Livestock Sector?1.For operationalizing scheme a Credit Guarantee fund Trust of ₹500.00 crores has been established.2. Credit Guarantee fund Trust will provide credit guarantee coverage up to 25% of the credit facilities extended to the MSMEs by the eligible lending institutions.3. It facilitates access to finance for un-served and under-served livestock sector, making availability of financial assistance from lenders to mainly first-generation entrepreneurs and under privileged section of society.
options: (A) 1, 2 and 3
(B) Only 1
(C) Only 2
(D) Only 1 and 2
(E) None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not one of the goals of the National Mission for A Green India (Green India Mission)?
options: Increase the income through tree based products
Increased forest/ tree cover on 5 m ha (million hectares) of forest/non-forest lands and improved quality of forest cover on another 5 m ha (a total of 10 m ha)
Improved ecosystem services including biodiversity, hydrological services and carbon sequestration
Enhanced annual CO2 sequestration
Increased forest-based livelihood income of households living in and around the forests

quiz.text: In which of the following areas does the National Mission for A Green India (Green India Mission) focuses on? 1. Biodiversity 2. Water 3. Biomass 4. Mangroves 5. Wetlands
options: 1, 2, 3 and 4
1, 3, 4 and 5
2, 3, 4 and 5
1 and 3
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are not correct with reference to the National Mission for A Green India (Green India Mission)? 1. It focuses on enhancing carbon sinks in sustainably managed forests and other ecosystems. 2. Traditional Ecological Knowledge of communities, along with forestry science and state-of-the-art technology would improve the Mission interventions.  3. It is one of 8 mission under National Mission on Sustainable Agriculture.
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Only 1 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to the above scheme? A. In 2014, the ‘Jan Aushadhi Scheme’ has been revisited and renamed as ‘Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Janaushadhi Pariyojana’ (PMBJP). B. Pharmaceuticals & Medical Devices Bureau of India is implementing agency. C. The medicines listed in the product list of PMBJP are procured only from World Health Organization – Good Manufacturing Practices (WHO-GMP) certified suppliers.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: What is the total number of Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Jan Aushadhi Kendras which will be set up by by March 2025?
options: 6000
8000
10500
12000
15000

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to the incentives provided in the above mentioned scheme?

A. The incentive provided to the Kendra owners has been enhanced to up to Rs 5 lakh.

B. An additional one time incentive of Rs. 1 lakh has been approved for stores opened in specified area.

C. PMBJP Kendras run by women entrepreneurs, Divyang, SC, & ST gets an amount of Rs. 2 lakh as special incentive.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which statement(s) among the following is/are correct with respect to SAMARTH - Scheme for Capacity Building in Textile Sector? 1. Scheme aim to provide demand driven, placement oriented National Skills Qualifications Framework (NSQF) compliant skilling programmes to create jobs in the organized textile and related sectors, covering the entire value chain of textile, including Spinning and Weaving. 2. Scheme targets to train 10 lakh persons.
3.Trainee under the scheme must be a citizen of India possessing an Aadhaar Card (unless exempted under Aadhaar Act) with age over 18 years.
options: Only 1 and 2
Only 1 and 3
Only 2
Only 1
Only 2 and 3

quiz.text: Ministry of Textiles has partnered with Textile Industries / Industry Associations, Central / State Government Agencies and Sectoral Organizations of the Ministry for undertaking training programmes under SAMARTH, which of the following statement is incorrect with respect to training under the SAMARTH - Scheme for Capacity Building in Textile Sector?
options: Scheme is formulated as per broad skilling framework adopted by Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship (MSDE)
There is placement guarantee of 80% successful trainees for courses in organised sector
For courses in traditional sector, atleast 50% are to be placed in wage employment
Post Placement tracking for 1 year is mandatory under the scheme
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with reference to SAMARTH - Scheme for Capacity Building in Textile Sector?
1. Scheme approved in continuation to Integrated Skill Development Scheme (ISDS) initially in 2018 for a period of 3 years.
2. Scheme comprises entry level skilling (Fresh workers) and Upskilling (existing worker).
3. In addition to domain specific hard skills, the program shall also provide 30 hours of soft skills.
options: (A) Only 2 and 3
(B) Only 2
(C) Only 1
(D) Only 1 and 2
(E) All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are incorrect with respect to the above scheme? 1. Under Part-1 of the scheme any person including Company/Firm/LLP/Trust willing to create a separate manufacturing company and invest minimum ₹200 Crore (excluding land and administrative building cost) are eligible. 2. In Part-1 they are eligible to get incentive when they achieve a minimum of ₹500 Crore turnover by first Performance Year. 3. Financial Allocation is ₹10,683 crore for production over a span of 5 years from FY 2025-26 to FY 2029-30.
options: 1 and 2
1 and 3
Only 2
Only 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to the scheme mentioned in the above paragraph? 1. Priority will be given to investment in Aspirational Districts, Tier 1, Tier 2 towns and urban areas. 2. Any person including Company/Firm/LLP/Trust willing to create a separate manufacturing company and invest minimum ₹100 Crore (excluding land and administrative building cost) is eligible in part 2 of the scheme. 3. In case of fast paced investment when threshold investment and threshold turnover is achieved by FY 2023-24, incentive cannot be given.
options: 1 and 2
1 and 3
2 and 3
Only 2
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following are the major initiatives taken under Atal Innovation Mission (AIM)? A. Atal Tinkering Labs B. Atal Incubation Centers C. Atal New India Challenges D. Mentor India Campaign
options: A, B, C
A, C, D
B, C, D
A, B, D
A, B, C, D

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to Atal Innovation Mission (AIM)? A. It aims to create and promote a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship across the length and breadth of country B. Government has set a target of establishing 101 Atal Incubation Centres and 5000 Atal Tinkering Labs C. Grant-in-aid of Rs. 10 Lakh is provided to each school establishing Atal Tinkering Labs
options: Only A
A and C
Only B
B and C
Only C

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to Atal New India Challenges under Atal Innovation Mission (AIM)? A. Any Indian company incorporated under the Companies Act 1956/2013 is eligible, preferably a MSME B. It targets to support 200 startups C. Funding of up to INR 5 crore is provided for each winner start-up / MSME
options: A and C
B and C
A and B
A, B and C
None of the above
